alert.note: Alert for Lee (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 26 at 8:20PM CDT until April 08 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Mississippi...Arkansas... Mississippi River at Tunica Mhoon Landing For the Lower Mississippi River...including Tiptonville, Caruthersville, Osceola, Memphis, Tunica Mhoon Landing, Helena... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY, APRIL 08... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Tunica Mhoon Landing. * WHEN...Until Saturday, April 08. * IMPACTS...At 29.0 feet, In Mississippi, roads to the hunting camps in the Buck Lake and Flower Lake areas are flooded. South evacuation road from Bordeaux Island is flooded. In Arkansas, the road to the fields inside the levee south of Horseshoe Lake are covered. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CDT Sunday the stage was 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 28.6 feet Tuesday, April 04. - Action stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood stage is 30.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
